adjective.description: "phoronic acid", a crystalline acid obtained by oxidizing camphoric acid; 2,6-dimethylheptan-4-one-2,6-dicarboxylic acid, HOOCC(CH₃)₂CH₂COCH₂C(CH₃)₂COOH.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From phorone + -ic, after French phoronique.
